results.title: 'Screen It' 2016 [winning entries and special mentions]
results.brief_description:
‘Screen It’ was Australia’s national film, animation and game making competition for school-aged students, run by ACMI for 16 years to 2019.

Designed to encourage imagination and inventiveness in primary and secondary school students, ‘Screen It’ fostered a new generation of young media makers. In 2016 budding young film and game-makers took up the challenge of creating their own short film or game in response to the theme ‘Mystery.’

Witness first-hand the amazing winning entries of the 2016 Screen It competition!

results.title: A Wilted Flower
results.brief_description: Winner in the Middle Live Action category. In a student-made, psychological and mental-health themed short film, a girl, followed by the dark side and thoughts of herself must overcome a presence in her life, or fail and succumb to it. A dark cloud can wilt any flower, but can this flower find the light again?

results.creator_credit: Jeremy Swan, Brendan Maher, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: From the producers of “Round the twist” and “Skytrackers” the next two episodes in this series are: “Good cop, bad genie” and “Customs” and continue the adventures of Penelope Townes and the two genies Bruce and his son Baz.

results.title: Balloon safari = Safari by balloon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survival Anglia Wildlife Series”.
Shows cameraman, Alan Root, and his wife Jean’s experiences with their own hot air balloon over Kenya. As they were learning how to operate it, forced landings in lakes, thick bush and herds of animals became almost daily occurrences. The Root’s balloon adventures took them across some of the most spectacular places in Africa, but they were drawn towards Mount Kilimanjaro, in Tanzania, where they realised their ambition to fly by balloon above its snow-capped peak.

results.title: The Shackles You Cannot See
results.creator_credit: Robyn Fairbairn and St Mary's Anglican Girls' College
results.brief_description: Special Mention in the Senior Live Action category. The premise of The Shackles You Cannot See is to explore the blurred lines between Fate vs. Free Will in the Modern World. As a futuristic dystopian narrative, it stands as a warning of the consequences of technological advances, to make people question their actions in their daily life, as well as question their rights to psychological and physical freedom.

results.title: The Professor
results.brief_description: A Special Mention in the Middle Live Action category. Set in the 1900’s, there has been a series of unsolved murders. Two professors have been put on the case. Unfortunately for one he doesn’t know who his partner is until it’s too late.

results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: From the producers of “Round the twist” and “Skytrackers” comes a series about a young girl, Penelope Townes who finds a magic opal which contains two genies, Bruce and his son Baz. She thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have everything she wants. Bruce, however has other ideas. The first three episodes of this series are: “Wishing and hoping”, “It’s my opal…and I’ll cry if I want to” and Where it’s at.

results.title: Gorilla - Sharing a Closer Relationship
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survival Anglia Wildlife Series”.
It is not known how many gorillas are left in Africa. Possibly as many as 15,000, maybe as few as 5,000. Their natural habitat of inaccessible high altitude rain forests is being felled and cleared and the greatest of the great apes has become an endangered species. This fascinating film tells the story of one man’s struggle to protect one small population of gorillas on the slopes of Mount Kahuzi in Zaire and of his incredible relationship with Kasimir, the great silverbacked male and his family. It took Adrian Deschryver four years of daily contact and study to persuade the gorillas to let him approach closely, during which time he was charged many times by Kasimir and other senior males. They now let him move with them through the forest, watching them feed, eat and play. This is the most complete record ever obtained on film of these imposing and elusive animals. Rated: G

results.title: My Brother's Bedroom
results.brief_description: A winner in the Junior Animation category for Screen It 2016. My brother’s bedroom door was always closed. I was never allowed into his bedroom. What was the mystery? I couldn’t stand it any longer and had to risk everything to have a look at what was behind his bedroom door.

results.title: The Genie from down under: where it's at
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Bruce wants to become human but to do this he must take the opal to the cave where it was mined over a hundred years before. He sets out to trick Penelope into visiting the cave.
